meanings.definition: The part of the arm between the elbow and the wrist.
meanings.sent1: She wore a bracelet on her forearm.
meanings.sent2: He rolled up his sleeves, revealing his muscular forearm.
meanings.sent3: The watch on her forearm seemed to have a mind of its own, always running fast.
meanings.sent4: His forearm was like a sturdy pillar supporting his body during the push-up.
meanings.sent5: The tattoo of a dragon on his forearm looked fierce and colorful.

meanings.sent1: They decided to forearm themselves with knowledge before the exam.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers needed to forearm themselves with weapons for the battle.
meanings.sent3: She tried to forearm her team with motivational speeches before the big game.
meanings.sent4: He wanted to forearm his argument with strong evidence.
meanings.sent5: The detective needed to forearm himself with information to solve the case.
